text:
Hello everyone,

I wanted to discuss about our CMS (Content Management System) which we have created on HubSpot CMS. Currently, we have a search bar in our CMS that shows matching search results in a dropdown format. While our platform is built on VueJS and we would like to integrate our HubSpot CMS search bar into our SPA (Single Page Application).

We are seeking guidance on the best approach to achieve this integration. If anyone help us out on that, it would be highly appreciated.

Thank you.

Is there documentation on `--assetVersion` for the `fetch` command? It is referenced <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/new-versions-of-default-cms-site-search-input-and-search-results-modules|here>.
Also can we provide asset versions to theme modules?
If I was using vue.js, then I’d just create my own component and use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/site-search|cms site search api>
are you talking about the new standard image gallery module?
Is there something like this module in the wild? I’m curious how tabs within tabs would display on mobile
<@U3T21PDBK> I am rethinking this for that very reason. This was something that a team shared with me to consider for developing.
haha tell them other _not-to-be-named_ devs said this was a terrible UX idea :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
maybe not quite so harshly though lol

Well hello people - I’m being driven nuts by a problem I’m attempting to solve for within a custom quote template and its modules. Hoping one of you can save the day.

I have several line item modules that are to be used in a single quote theme/template. Within these modules, I have a great deal of calculations being performed based on line item values. These values do not match those supplied within the templateData variable.

The catch - I need to roll all of these calculated values up to either the template, or another module to then render it on the page. Is this possible? If so, how on Earth do I do this. I’ve spent the past hour getting creative with searches in both google and in this slack. To no avail.

Happy to provide more details if needed, but as a quick example:

locally set variable, “total_price_1” in line_item_mod_1 == 1
locally set variable, “total_price_2" in line_item_mod_2 == 2

I want to be able to access both values, 1 and 2 at the template level (total_price_1 + total_price_2 = 3).

I imagine it working using something similar in concept to…widget_data.line_item_mod_1 + widget_data.line_item_mod_2. Perhaps by setting both values to module fields?

After internal discussion with the wizard himself, <@U04N6N424MB> - I’m likely going to resort to JS to fix this. Either by using cookies, localStorage or simply reading cell values using querySelector.

However, in the event someone has a cleaner, more HubSpot/hubl centric solution, I’d love to hear it.
